concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Scheme for Meritorious students to pursue Higher Secondary Education in the best schools of TamilNadu

eligibility_criteria.other_details:
BC (3 Boys and 3 Girls) MBC / DNC (2 Boys and 2 Girls)
Should belong to BC/MBC/DNC/
The parental annual income should not exceed Rs.1.00 lakh

how_to_avail: Schools
description: Financial assistance is given to 10 students from each district who secure the highest marks in 10th Public examination by studying in Government High Schools to pursue their higher secondary education in the best private schools of their choice in Tamil Nadu.

concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Prize Schemes to the Students STATE LEVEL PRIZES

eligibility_criteria.other_details:
1. Students should belong to BC/ MBC / DNC
2. There is no income limit for receiving awards.
3. Students studying in Government/Government Aided and Private Schools.
4. Students should have studied Tamil as the first Language.
5. State Level Topper students who are awarded prizes in the Education Department are not eligible to receive prizes in this Department.
6. If more than one student secures the same marks, awards are granted to all students.

how_to_avail: Schools
description:
FIRST PRIZE
Four First Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.50,000/-
Rs.25,000/-
SECOND PRIZE
Four Second Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.30,000/-
Rs.20,000/-
THIRD PRIZE
Four Third Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.20,000/-
Rs.15,000/-

concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: PRE-MATRIC SCHOLARSHIP SCHEME

how_to_avail: Students studying from 6th to 10th std in English Medium
description:
Tuition Fee From 6th to 8th Standard Rs.200/- at the rate of Rs.20/- per month for 10 months For 9th and 10th Standard Rs.250/- at the rate of Rs.25/- per month for 10 months Examination Fee Sanctioned in full for 10th Standard Students Conditions for Backward Classes Students
1) The income of the parents should not exceed Rs.1,00,000/-
2) There should be no graduate in the family.
Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities Students No conditions

scheme_details.associated_scheme: Sanctioned from 11th Standard to Research level as per the rates prescribed in the Scholarship Notification

Tuition Fee Rs.500/- at the rate of Rs.50/- per month for 10 months Examination Fee Sanctioned in full for 12th Standard Students Conditions for Backward Classes Students
1. The income of the parents should not exceed Rs.1,00,000/-
2. There should be no graduate in the family.
Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities Students No conditions Special fees, Tuition

how_to_avail: Refer in Govt.School
description: Students studying in 11th and 12th std in English Medium

- Agricultural Officer / Deputy Agricultural Officer at the Block Level
- The Assistant Director of Agriculture at the Block Level
- The Joint Director of Agriculture at the District Level
description: A lumpsum provision of Rs.17,000 is allowed towards Demonstration of 40 Ha. each and Training per Farmers Field School through cluster approach.

concerned_department: Agriculture - Farmers Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Farm Production System and micro enterprises - Sponsored By State Govt
scheme_details.funding_pattern: Subsidy :1560/-

how_to_avail: 1) Chairman / District Collector, 2) Project Officer / Joint Director of Agriculture, DWDA, (PIA) at District level. 1) Chief Executive Officer, State Level Nodal Agency, Chennai-32 (at State level)
description: Demonstration for popularizing new crops/varieties, and new technologies in Agriculture and allied sectors. Diversification of production systems like Dryland Horticulture, Agro Forestry, Household production system, Adoption of proven technology, activities like INM, IPM, Fodder development, Organic farming, Multiple cropping, Improved intercropping seed village concept, Fisheries development in village ponds, farm ponds and tanks, Sericulture, backyard poultry, Livestock management and other micro-enterprises etc. are carried out under this component.

organisation_name: SCHEMES AVAILABLE TO MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES IN TAMIL NADU

scheme_details.title_name: Stamp Duty Exemption on Mortgaged and Pledged Documents
scheme_details.funding_pattern: Quantum of incentives - 100%

how_to_avail:
1. For issue of Eligibility Certificate (EC)
   Within three months from the date of commencement of production or date of power connection, whichever is later.

2. For submission of subsidy claims
   The first claim should be preferred within 30 days from the date of issue of EC. Subsequent claims should be submitted once in six months, i.e., the bills raised by Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation Limited from January to June should be preferred before August 31st of the year and from July to December before 28th of February of the succeeding year.
description: Anywhere in the state

concerned_department: Agriculture - Farmers Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Special Capital Subsidy for Thrust Sector Enterprises
scheme_details.funding_pattern: 15% of Plant and Machinery value

how_to_avail: Within one year from the Date of Commencement of Production
description:
For 13 identified thrust sectors viz:-
1. Electrical and Electronics Industry
2. Leather and Leather goods.
3. Auto parts and components
4. Drugs and Pharmaceuticals
5. Solar Energy Equipment
6. Gold and Diamond Jewellery for exports
7. Pollution Control Equipments.
8. Sports Goods and Accessories.
9. Cost-effective building material.
10. Readymade Garments.
11. Food Processing.
12. Plastic.
13. Rubber.
14. Any other industries to be notified by the Government from time to time.

For submission of subsidy claims - The first claim should be preferred within 30 days from the date of issue of EC. Subsequent claims should be submitted once in six months, i.e., the bills raised by TNEB from January to June should be preferred before August 31st of the year and from July to December before 28th of February of the succeeding year.

All 385 blocks in the State for Agro based enterprises.

how_to_avail: CADW through educational institutions.

concerned_department: Labour Welfare and Skill Development Department

scheme_details.title_name: Abolition of Bonded Labour System

how_to_avail: Collector / Sub Collector / RDO
description: Persons kept as bonded labour are released and rehabilitated by providing financial assistance as a grant, to the tune of Rs.20,000/-. Of this, a sum of Rs.1000/- each will be given immediately on relief from Bondage. Remaining (Rs.19,000/-) amount will be given for rehabilitation through various kinds. Moreover, House site pattas, houses under the group housing scheme through IRDP, drinking water facility, and Bank loan assistance are provided to them. Released bonded labour without any caste and creed.

description: With a view to give quality education, 10 outstanding students from each District covering totally 320 Adi Dravidar/Tribal students who secure the highest marks in X standard in Government / Corporation / Municipal / Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare schools are taken and admitted in plus one in reputed private schools.

concerned_department: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: All India Service Examinations like I.A.S., I.P.S., I.R.S., etc.

how_to_avail: Director, Anna Institute of Management, Chennai-28.
description: Pre Examination training centre for All India Service Examinations like I.A.S., I.P.S., I.R.S., etc. boarding, lodging, coaching etc. are provided free of cost. Parental income should be below Rs.1.00 lakh per annum. Mess Charges Rs.1200 per month should be paid by the students whose parental income is above Rs.1 lakh per annum.

concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Milch animal loan schemes

how_to_avail: District Backward Classes and Minorities Welfare Officer/ Superintendent, Minorities of the District concerned (or) Regional Joint Registrar of Co-operative Societies or concerned Co-operative Banks.
description: Schemes of BC, MBC dept Milch animal loan schemes. The loan amount of Rs.30000 is sanctioned for two animals through Aavin. Loan is sanctioned for the purchase of Auto by forming Individual Co-op. Societies: 1. LPG Auto - Rs.121000, 2. Career Auto - Rs.128000, 3. Other Auto - Rs.100000. All the above loan schemes are sanctioned at 6% rate of interest per annum.

concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Grant-cum-loan scheme for small and medium farmers

how_to_avail: District Collector / District Backward Classes and Minorities Welfare Officer of the concerned district
description: Schemes of BC, MBC dept Grant-cum-loan scheme for small and medium farmers. For the upliftment of small and medium farmers of BC, MBC / DNC Communities, the Government has introduced a grant cum loan scheme.

concerned_department: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Book Bank - Books will be purchased for Medical/ Engineering/ Law / M.B.A./Veterinary / Agri. and Polytechnic / courses and placed in the Library.

how_to_avail: College Principal
description: Book Bank - Books will be purchased for Medical/ Engineering/ Law / M.B.A./Veterinary / Agri. and Polytechnic / courses and placed in the Library. On completion of the course, the students will return the books to the Library. Government of India Scholarship holder among AD/Tribal students. One set of Books will be supplied for every 2 students.

concerned_department: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Chief Minister's Merit Award

how_to_avail: District Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Officers through the educational Institutions.
description: Chief Minister's Merit Award - First 1000 Boys and First 1000 girls Adi Dravidar/Tribal / Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity who have passed 12th standard examination and continue their studies are given a sum of Rs.1500/- p.a. for 5 years. Should find a place in the list of first 1000 students who have passed 12th Std. Public Examination and who continue their studies among Adi Dravidar/Tribal / Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity students.

concerned_department: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Awards to Bright Students

how_to_avail: Director of Adi Dravidar Welfare, Chennai-5, through the Educational Institutions.
description: Awards to Bright Students - First two boys and two girls in each district from each community viz., Adi Dravidar/ Tribal / Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity who have passed 10th std., Public Examinations and continue their studies are given a sum of Rs.800/- for the first year and Rs.960/- for the next 5 years. Should have secured first and second place in the 10th Std, in the district. Continue their studies. No income limits.

concerned_department: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Book Bank - books will be purchased for medical/ engineering/ law / m.b.a./veterinary / agri. and polytechnic/courses and placed in the library.

description: Books will be purchased for Medical/ Engineering/ Law / M.B.A./Veterinary / Agri. and Polytechnic / courses and placed in the Library. Book Bank - For the benefit of students studying in Post Graduate Courses in Medical / Engg./ Agri./ Veterinary Post Graduate Technical courses, studies in law like BL/ LLB 3 Years and 5 years / LLM - ML (2 years) Chartered Accountants, Cost Accountants Intermediate, Final MBA ( 2 years) and other equivalent studies, Bio- Science. AD/ Tribal students who are getting Government of India Scholarship only.

how_to_avail: Director of Adi Dravidar Welfare, Chennai-5, through the Educational Institutions.
description: Annal Gandhi Memorial Award - Two (One Boy and One Girl) Hindu AD Students in each district who have secured first rank in the 12th Std Public Examinations and continue their studies. AD (Hindu) Students who have secured the first rank in the 12th Std. exam in the district level. Continue their studies. No income limit.

concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Free education scholarship for Professional Courses (Engineering, Medical, Agriculture, Veterinary and Law)

eligibility_criteria.community: Condition for Backward Classes, Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities students 1) The income of the parents should not exceed Rs.1,00,000/- 2) There should be no graduate in the family.

how_to_avail: Government and Government Aided Professional Colleges and in Self Financing Professional Colleges
description: Tuition fee, Special fee and other non-refundable compulsory fees are paid as prescribed by Government and Examination fee in full.

concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: Free education scholarship for three year Diploma (Polytechnic Courses)

eligibility_criteria.community: Tuition fee, Special fee and non-refundable compulsory fees are paid as prescribed by Government and examination fee in full. Condition for Backward Classes, Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities students 1) The income of the parents should not exceed Rs.1,00,000/- 2) There should not be any Diploma / Graduate in the family.

how_to_avail: Refer in govt polytechnic
description: Backward, Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities students studying in 3 year Diploma courses in Government and Government Aided Polytechnics.

concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: FREE EDUCATION SCHEME

eligibility_criteria.community: Special fee and other non-refundable compulsory fees are paid as prescribed by Government and examination fee in full. Condition: No conditions

how_to_avail: Refer Govt.college
description: Free education scholarship for three year U.G. degree Courses (B.A., B.Sc., and B.Com.,) Backward, Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities students studying in 3 year degree courses in Government and Government Aided Arts and Science Colleges.

concerned_department: BC, MBC & Minorities Welfare Department

scheme_details.title_name: DISTRICT LEVEL PRIZES PUBLIC EXAMINATION 10th Standard and 12th Standard

eligibility_criteria.community:
1. Students should belong to BC/ MBC / DNC.
2. There is no income limit for receiving awards.
3. Students studying in Government/Government Aided/Private Schools.
4. Students should have studied Tamil as first Language.
5. State Level Topper students who are awarded prizes in Education Department are not eligible to receive prize in BC/MBC Department.
6. If more than one student secure same marks, awards are granted to all students.

how_to_avail: Schools
description:
FIRST PRIZE Four First Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.6,000/-
Rs.3,000/-

SECOND PRIZE Four Second Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.4,000/-
Rs.2,000/-

THIRD PRIZE Four Third Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.2,000/-
Rs.1,000/-
